info.title: A sample API conforming to the OGC API - Coverages standard
info.description: This is a sample OpenAPI definition that conforms to the OGC API - Coverages Service specification (conformance classes: "Core", "Subset", "JSON", "HTML" and "OpenAPI 3.0").

tags.name: Capabilities
tags.description: Essential characteristics of this API including information about the data.

get.description: The landing page provides links to the API definition, the Conformance statements and the metadata about the coverage data in this dataset.

parameters.name: f
parameters.description: The optional f parameter indicates the output format which the server shall provide as part of the response document. It has preference over the HTTP Accept header. The default format is JSON.

get.description: most likely returning the document at hand

200.description: most likely returning the document at hand

get.description: list of all conformance classes that the server conforms to

parameters.name: f
parameters.description: The optional f parameter indicates the output format which the server shall provide as part of the response document. It has preference over the HTTP Accept header. The default format is JSON.

200.description: the URIs of all requirements classes supported by the server

get.summary: describe the collections in the dataset

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The optional limit parameter limits the number of collections that are
presented in the response document.

Only items are counted that are on the first level of the collection in
the response document. Nested objects contained within the explicitly
requested items shall not be counted.

* Minimum = 1
* Maximum = 10000
* Default = 10

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description:
Only collections that have a geometry that intersects the bounding box are selected. The bounding box is provided as four or six numbers, depending on whether the coordinate reference system includes a vertical axis (elevation or depth):
* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 1 * Lower left corner, coordinate axis 2 * Lower left corner, coordinate axis 3 (optional) * Upper right corner, coordinate axis 1 * Upper right corner, coordinate axis 2 * Upper right corner, coordinate axis 3 (optional)
The coordinate reference system of the values is WGS84 longitude/latitude (http://www.opengis.net/def/crs/OGC/1.3/CRS84) unless a different coordinate reference system is specified in the parameter `bbox-crs`.
For WGS84 longitude/latitude the values are in most cases the sequence of minimum longitude, minimum latitude, maximum longitude and maximum latitude. However, in cases where the box spans the antimeridian the first value (west-most box edge) is larger than the third value (east-most box edge).
If a collection has multiple spatial geometry properties, it is the decision of the server whether only a single spatial geometry property is used to determine the extent or all relevant geometries.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
Either a date-time or a period string that adheres to RFC 3339. Examples:
* A date-time: "2018-02-12T23:20:50Z" * A period: "2018-02-12T00:00:00Z/2018-03-18T12:31:12Z" or "2018-02-12T00:00:00Z/P1M6DT12H31M12S"
Only collections that have a temporal property that intersects the value of `time` are selected.
If a collection has multiple temporal properties, it is the decision of the server whether only a single temporal property is used to determine the extent or all relevant temporal properties.

parameters.name: f
parameters.description: The optional f parameter indicates the output format which the server shall provide as part of the response document. It has preference over the HTTP Accept header. The default format is JSON.

200.description: Metdata about the collections shared by this API.

get.summary: Collection Information is the set of metadata which describes a single collection, or in the the case of API-Coverages, a single Coverage.

200.description: Metadata about the {coverageid} collection shared by this API.

get.summary: description of the coverage offering identified by {coverageid} including envelope
get.description:
Coverage offering identified by {coverageid}.
Use content negotiation to request HTML or GeoJSON.

get.summary: returns the whole coverage description consisting of domainset, rangetype, and metadata (but not the rangeset)

description.description: A textual description of the API

links.description: Links to the resources exposed through this API.

example.title: OGC conformance classes implemented by this API
XML schema for Acme Corporation data

name.description: identifier of the collection used, for example, in URIs

title.description: human readable title of the collection

description.description: a description of the data in the collection

crs.description: The coordinate reference systems in which geometries may be retrieved. Coordinate reference systems are identified by a URI. The first coordinate reference system is the coordinate reference system that is used by default. This is always "http://www.opengis.net/def/crs/OGC/1.3/CRS84", i.e. WGS84 longitude/latitude.

Coordinate reference system of the coordinates in the spatial extent (property `spatial`). In the Core, only WGS84 longitude/latitude is supported. Extensions may support additional coordinate reference systems.

spatial.description: West, north, east, south edges of the spatial extent. The minimum and maximum values apply to the coordinate reference system WGS84 longitude/latitude that is supported in the Core. If, for example, a projected coordinate reference system is used, the minimum and maximum values need to be adjusted.

trs.description: Temporal reference system of the coordinates in the temporal extent (property `temporal`). In the Core, only the Gregorian calendar is supported. Extensions may support additional temporal reference systems.

temporal.description: Begin and end times of the temporal extent.

name.description: identifier of the collection used, for example, in URIs

title.description: human readable title of the collection

description.description: a description of the data in the collection

envelope.title: envelope
envelope.description: The envelope around a coverage is defined by the lower and upper bound of each axis, respectively. The purpose of the axisLabels attribute, which lists the axis labels of all axisExtent elements in proper sequence, is to enforce axis sequence also in XML systems which do not preserve document order.

rangetype.title: rangeType
rangetype.description: The rangeType element describes the structure and semantics of a coverage's range values, including (optionally) restrictions on the interpolation allowed on such values.

serviceMetadata.title: serviceMetadata
serviceMetadata.description: Coverage specific service metadata like native format, coverate type, etc.

* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 1 * Lower left corner, coordinate axis 2 * Lower left corner, coordinate axis 3 (optional) * Upper right corner, coordinate axis 1 * Upper right corner, coordinate axis 2 * Upper right corner, coordinate axis 3 (optional)
The coordinate reference system of the values is WGS84 longitude/latitude (http://www.opengis.net/def/crs/OGC/1.3/CRS84) unless a different coordinate reference system is specified in the parameter `bbox-crs`.

* A date-time: "2018-02-12T23:20:50Z" * A period: "2018-02-12T00:00:00Z/2018-03-18T12:31:12Z" or "2018-02-12T00:00:00Z/P1M6DT12H31M12S"

f.name: f
f.description: The optional f parameter indicates the output format which the server shall provide as part of the response document. It has preference over the HTTP Accept header. The default format is JSON.

subset.name: subset
subset.description: get a subset of the coverage by slicing or trimming among one axis

rangeSubset.name: rangeSubset
rangeSubset.description: subset the resulting coverage by choosing and/or rearrange particular fields

scaleFactor.name: scaleFactor
scaleFactor.description: scale the resulting coverage either among all axes by a given factor

scaleAxis.name: scaleAxis
scaleAxis.description: scale the resulting coverage either among one axis by a given factor

scaleSize.name: scaleSize
scaleSize.description: scale the resulting coverage either among one axis to a given size

scaleExtent.name: scaleExtent
scaleExtent.description: scale the resulting coverage either among one axis to a given extent

subsettingCrs.name: subsettingcrs
subsettingCrs.description: specify the projection in which the subsets are expressed

outputCrs.name: outputcrs
outputCrs.description: reproject the output coverage to the given

interpolation.name: interpolation
interpolation.description: specify the interpolation method used during reprojection and scaling
